content:
I note that the "Troubleshooting Information" page was not helpful; the zombie account username did not appear there.

The "Config Editor" was more help; clicking "Show All", then ticking "Show only modified preferences" whittled down the number of entries, then Ctrl-f allowed me to search for occurrences of the zombie. I found it in 2 places:

1) As a calendar account, though this account was NOT shown in the list of calendars on the left side of the "Calendars" tab. I think I did a decent job of deleting the various entries relating to the zombie, including the metaentries consisting of GUIDs and such of entries.

2) As an SMTP server, though this account was NOT shown in the list of SMTP servers in the "Account Settings" tab. Again, more tedious deletion of entries and searching for and deleting metadata in metaentries.

The fact that a deleted account was still being used, as evidenced by the regular popup of the OAuth prompt, yet was NOT shown in the main interfaces which purport to shows accounts, is ... an unexpected feature. Not a highly-rated one.

The zombie account is overdue for popping up another OAuth prompt, so there is hope that grunging about in "Config Editor", plus the holy water I sprinkled in the offering slot at the top of my server case, seems to have finally laid it to rest.
creator: retardude

content: You're not the first user to experience this, and it seems to happen after the upgrade to TB 128. A similar issue is with MS accounts prompting for a password as if the authentication is 'normal password', when all accounts have been switched to OAuth2.

content:
The server must be outlook.office365.com in order to apply OAuth2 authentication. Similarly, for outgoing, it must be smtp.office365.com.

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/microsoft-oauth-authentication-and-thunderbird-202

creator: davidsk

content: That was it david - many thanks !
creator: john391

content:
To share a bit more: threading has been the default since summer of 2022. This is the official (to my knowledge) documentation. Well worth the read https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/message-threading-thunderbird

Cutting to the quick fix: 

More info:  To change default for *new* folders, In config editor, you can change default that applies to NEW folders you set up: mailnews.default_view_flags      0 =unthreaded    Config editor is available at Tools>settings>general and scroll to bottom right.   Here is another way to change the threaded option:  - create a simple text file with name of user.js with these lines:       // Set default threading to UNthreaded  ###   <== this line is optional, just for documentation      user_pref("mailnews.default_view_flags", 0); - install Thunderbird and exit prior to setting up accounts	  - copy the user.js file into the profile - now, when you start Thunderbird, unthreading will be the default. Problem solved.
creator: davidsk

content:
Change the incoming to outlook.office365.com, 993, SSL/TLS, OAuth2, email address; outgoing smtp.office365.com, 587, STARTTLS, email address. Restart TB after making changes.

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/microsoft-oauth-authentication-and-thunderbird-202
creator: sfhowes

content:
Hi again,

Just to add some extra information. I think I have managed to find the Thunderbird local folders. I had forgotten that the Mac OS hides the user library. So I found a way to access the library and attached is what I found under "Thunderbird". I'm still not sure if this is the right place for local folders.

DanZ
creator: donlf

content:
Close TB, open the profile folder pv4x..., copy the mbox file into the Mail/Local Folders subfolder, remove the .mbox extension if it's present, restart TB, find the folder under Local Folders in the Folder Pane.

You can always open the profile folder from Help/Troubleshooting Info, Profile Folder, Show in Finder. Also, from Help/Troubleshooting Info, about:profiles.
creator: sfhowes

content: Please provide information on how you migrated the account.
creator: davidsk

content: You need to change in on the email provider's site, not here. For example, if it was a gmail account, go to gmail.com to change it. And then thunderbird will need to be advised of the change so it can continue managing the account.
creator: davidsk

content: Esattamente che procedura hai seguito per spostare Thunderbird dal vecchio al nuovo PC?
creator: @next

content:
Mozilla does not have the resources to have call centres to do one on one support for their main products like the Firefox web browser for desktop and mobile.

Thunderbird is operated by the Mozilla Foundation's subsidiary MZLA Technologies Corporation. Thunderbird is an independent, community-driven project that is managed and overseen by the Thunderbird Council.

It is generally the paid for apps or subscription based apps that may get more direct or one on one support by phone, chat, email or ticket because they well paid for it. Mozilla does have some subscription based products (like Mozilla VPN) that gets direct ticket support here.

Short answer is No, there is no one on one support by phone, chat, email or ticket for the open source free to download and user Thunderbird email client.

Also you should not post your phone#, full email or such on this public community support forum as search engines and other bots may find it.
creator: James
